title: Telangana Food Safety department cracks down on food outlets
content: Food outlets were flagged for highly unhygienic kitchen conditions, pest and rodent infestation, uncovered and unlabelled food items, clogged drainage, improper segregation of vegetarian and non-vegetarian sections, and suspected use of synthetic food colours.

title: India to hold tri-Service exercise in Arunachal's Mechuka
content: 'Poorvi Prachand Prahar' exercise, conceived as a forward-looking exercise, will validate multi-domain integration across land, air, and maritime fronts, reflecting the Indian Armed Forces' evolving readiness for future conflicts, says Lt. Col. Mahendra Rawat

title: Supreme Court to hear stray dogs case on November 3; Chief Secretaries of States, UTs to appear in court
content: The matter is slated to come up for hearing before a three-Judge special Bench comprising Justices Vikram Nath, Sandeep Mehta and N.V. Anjaria

title: 10-year-old Dailt girl raped in U.P.’s Mathura: Police
content: The incident took place on November 1 when the survivor and her sister were washing clothes near a well in their village, said police

title: Gogoi says he'll raise issues concerning Northeast universities in Parliament
content: "Recently, many top universities in the northeast have been in the news for the wrong reasons, such as Tezpur University, NEHU and the Guwahati University. Often it is the action of the Vice Chancellor which has raised concerns," Gaurav Gogoi said in a post on X.

title: Former IPS officer appeals against appointment of advocate commissioner to record Dhoni’s evidence
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq of the Madras High Court decide to hear the appeal on November 4

title: Leaders turn morning walks into poll campaigns in Jubilee Hills bypoll
content: Morning walk interactions have emerged as an effective medium of voter engagement, bringing together people of all age groups in a relaxed setting

title: Delhi's air quality 'very poor', slow wind speed reduces dispersion of pollutants
content: The national capital's Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 386 in the morning, and the air quality is likely to remain in the 'very poor' category till November 4

title: ‘Cruel joke’: Congress takes swipe at Delhi govt over cloud seeding
content: Winter cloud seeding certainly looks very dramatic and gives the impression that something is demonstrably being done by the government, Jairam Ramesh said.

title: Hyderabad paediatrician welcomes Delhi HC’s verdict upholding FSSAI’s ban on misuse of ‘ORS’, calls it a victory for India
content: Dr. Sivaranjani, who led the legal campaign that prompted the regulatory action, said the verdict is a victory for India and that not a single child’s life should be endangered because of misleading labels

title: In frames | Feast of feasts
content: Wazwan, Kashmir’s elaborate multi-course mutton feast, blends Central Asian heritage with culinary artistry; the dishes, prepared by master wazas, symbolise Kashmiri hospitality, tradition, and community during important occasions

title: Two women workers killed in fire at chemical warehouse in Indore
content: The incident took place when lamps were being lit on the occasion of Devuthani Ekadashi, and the owner of the warehouse was also injured, an official said

title: ‘Chhote Sarkar’ and ‘Dada’  locked in tense rivalry in Bihar’s Mokama
content: The heated rivalry came to the fore on October 30, when 1990s-era strongman and Jan Suraaj Party leader Dularchand Yadav, a close aide of Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad, was shot dead in a taal (wetland).

title: Death linked to cow vigilantes sparks protest in Maharashtra’s Ahilyanagar
content: The boy was reportedly assaulted and humiliated by ‘cow vigilantes’; the video of the assault has gone viral; Dhangar quota activists meet SP, raise questions over police accountability

title: Unregulated construction and tourism behind floods and landslides in north Bengal, warn experts
content: Scientists say ecologically fragile slopes, deforestation and reduced river capacity have intensified the scale of recent disasters

title: Kerala Agricultural University to reconsider course fee hike: Minister
content: P. Prasad held a meeting with KAU authorities after student organisations carried out mass protests against the revised course fees

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: PM Modi to address rallies, take part in roadshow
content: This will be the third roadshow in Patna by the PM since last year's Lok Sabha polls. Mr. Modi had held a roadshow earlier this year, soon after 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Beautification drive on for Partnership Summit in Vizag
content: Collector Harendira Prasad has directed the officials concerned to make the parks and tourist spots more attractive

title: People ready to cut Congress to size in J.H. bypoll: KTR
content: MLC Dasoju Sravan Kumar said the Chief Minister had reduced governance in Telangana to “panic politics”, acting out of fear rather than public confidence

title: Training begins for 115 newly-recruited Excise officers in Telangana
content: The group includes 31 AES candidates selected through the TSPSC Group-I examination and 84 SIS candidates recruited through Group-II

title: Maharashtra woman doctor's death: Jarange meets her kin, gets them to speak to CM Fadnavis, Dy CM
content: Mr. Jarange met her family in Kavadgaon in Wadwani tehsil and assured them of his support in their fight for justice

title: Gaming app for Arunachal children to know rights, sniff danger
content: Chief Minister Pema Khandu launched ‘Choo-Man-Tar’ to sensitise parents and children about good touch and bad touch

title: Bihar ex-MLA Anant Singh, 2 others arrested over Dular Chand Yadav death case in Mokama
content: The JD(U) candidate, who is contesting the election as a NDA nominee, was arrested by the police from his house in Mokama in the wee hours on Sunday

title: Francesca Orsini: Scholar of the east
content: The deportation of the literary historian, known for her seminal works on Hindi and Urdu, over ‘violation’ of visa rules came both as surprise and shock for many

title: CPI(ML)-Liberation: Naxalbari to Vidhan Sabha
content: The former Naxalite outfit’s strategic shift to electoral politics yielded a credible 2020 Bihar performance and made it a key, ideologically driven partner in the INDIA bloc

title: Ernakulam records two dengue deaths in October
content: District registers a total of 533 dengue cases during the month, including 138 confirmed and 395 suspected cases; seven deaths reported in State

title: PM SHRI: Between funds and ideology
content: Kerala signed up for the Union government’s flagship school education scheme after three years of resistance only to pause the agreement amid strong opposition from a coalition partner of the ruling Left Democratic Front

title: Widening of ECR from Kottivakkam to Akkarai to be completed by Jan.
content: The 8.6-km stretch will be converted to six lanes; land acquisition issues that delayed the project have now been rectified, says Minister E.V. Velu

title: CPI(M) deploys ‘red volunteers’ to assist electors with SIR in West Bengal
content: Red volunteers rose to prominence during the Covid-19 pandemic and cyclone Amphan, which ravaged parts of the State in 2021

title: CHOs urge govt. to address long-pending demands
content: Their demands include removal of Facial Recognition System, payment of incentive arrears and rent, provision of transport allowance, and a fixed pay

title: ‘Leaders in States are unable to understand that good industrial environment cannot be created by suppressing labour’
content: All India Trade Union Congress general secretary Amarjeet Kaur says across the world, business has flourished where labour interest is protected

title: BC hostel inmate goes missing at sea; Minister directs officials to deploy Coast Guard teams to trace the victim
content: Bhanu Prasad, along with two inmates and another boy, skips school and goes to Muthyalammapalem Beach for a bath; while Bhanu Prasad has been swept away, fishermen rescue the other three

title: Vellore MP flags off low-floor buses for Vellore and Ranipet
content: TNSTC officials said that the new low-floor buses are beneficial especially for persons with disabilities as these buses have a kneeling facility for wheelchair ramps.

title: Chief Minister Stalin virtually inaugurates two ROBs near Katpadi
content: Originally given a nod in 2015, the two new bridges were jointly done by the Southern Railway and State Highways on a 50:50 fund basis under Railways Works Scheme 2015-16.

title: Bike thieves held in Arakkonam; nine two-wheelers recovered
content: Police said the duo told them that they target two-wheelers that are parked hurriedly by owners in public places.

title: AI-powered Kalika Deepa to help Karnataka students gain proficiency in maths, English, and Kannada
content: The State government has rolled out the Kalika Deepa programme to help students from class 4 to 6 of government schools to enhance competency in mathematics, English, and Kannada, with the help of Artificial Intelligence

title: Tamil Nadu’s paddy procurement during lean season not so lean anymore
content: According to the data available on the Central Food Grains Procurement Portal, the lean season’s share of paddy was a little less than 16% four years go. During the September 2024 to August 2025 procurement year, it rose to around 40%

title: Andhra Pradesh temple stampede: Lokesh says rush of devotees was unexpected
content: Nine out of 10 have visited the temple for the first time on Saturday. The local police, administration or the temple management had no idea that such a huge devotee turnout will be there, the Minister said

title: Lucknow enters UNESCO list as ‘Creative City of Gastronomy’
content: Global recognition celebrates the city’s centuries-old Awadhi cuisine, living food traditions and inclusive cultural heritage

title: CBI gets five-day remand of suspended Punjab DIG arrested on bribery charges
content: The CBI points out that Harcharan Singh Bhullar’s chats suggest a pattern to influence judicial orders, decisions

title: Support pours in for protest against waste treatment plant
content: A meeting held at Koodathai in support of the protest was attended by about 40 participants representing seven Mahal committees, five parishes, and parent-teacher associations of three schools in the affected area

title: Kerala High Court launches legal glossary
content: The glossary is launched with the objective of ensuring clarity, accuracy, and uniformity in the use of legal terminology in Malayalam

title: Reach out to distressed farmers, Congress urges Uttar Pradesh CM
content: Opposition parties call for State-wide survey, financial assistance after reports of suicide by a farmer in Jhansi due to stress over unseasonal rain destroying crop

title: BRS and BJP have an adhesive bond: Revanth Reddy
content: The BRS while it was in power for 10 years had failed to tackle civic issues in areas such as Borabanda and today the same party claims it would bring about changes there, the CM said

title: We have brought in reforms to help the public, says Karnataka Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda
content: Revenue Minister Krishna Byregowda stated that the State Government would submit a memorandum to the Centre seeking funds to compensate the damage caused to public instructure due to rains

title: Former spokesperson blames BJP leadership for councillor’s suicide
content: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation councillor died by suicide in September this year, following a financial crisis at a cooperative society he had headed. Spokesperson M.S. Kumar says the society he had helmed too is struggling due to non-payment of dues by BJP leaders and workers

title: Foundation for semiconductor production unit laid in Bhubaneswar
content: Approved under the India Semiconductor Mission, the integrated facility is expected to be operational by 2027-28, and entails an investment of ₹2,067 crore

title: Vishnu Deo Sai: Bastar rising beyond its scars
content: Peace and development are returning to this remote tribal heartland, which was under the shadow of Maoist violence and isolation for decades

title: Bihar Assembly polls: CPI(M) issues manifesto, accuses NDA of running a ‘negative campaign’
content: The NDA has been running a negative campaign while pointing fingers at the Opposition leaders, which is perhaps inevitable for them since they have nothing to showcase by way of achievements of the last two decades, says CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat

title: Government reserves 85% PG medical seats for Telangana students
content: Telangana students will now have access to 85% of these seats, while the remaining 15% will continue to be open to All-India candidates

title: Kerala’s extreme poverty-free status a realisation of the basic ideal of economic equality: Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Actor Mammootty, the chief guest, made his first public appearance after a gap of eight months following a break from acting to undergo medical treatment.

title: Tech advances have made healthcare accessible in remote villages, says APSCHE Chairman
content: Madhu Murthy highlights Dr. NTRUHS’s pioneering role in health education; says technological progress is transforming medical services and training across Andhra Pradesh

title: Study tour for top scorers in Kannada medium
content: Kannada medium students who have scored 625 out of 625 in the SSLC examination will be taken for study tour by Karnataka Bal Vikas Academy, Chairman of the Academy Sangamesh Babaleshwar has said.

title: With AI’s help, trees in Idukki college tell their tale
content: ‘Vruksha Vedam’, an AI-powered project, launched in College of Applied Science at Kanthallur under which QR codes have been fixed on 80 trees. Visitors can access details of the trees, apart from poems and novels on them, by scanning QR codes

title: Amit Shah, Nitish Kumar warn of the return of ‘jungle raj’ with the RJD; Tejashwi pushes back
content: In a video address, the Union Minister recalled the notoriety of Sadhu Yadav, brother-in-law of RJD chief Lalu Prasad, during the previous RJD regime; Tejashwi Yadav hit out at the PM over a recent spate of killings in Bihar

title: Haryana CM releases ₹2,100 each to eligible women beneficiaries
content: Nayab Singh Saini says the Deen Dayal Lado Lakshmi scheme is aimed at promoting self-reliance and economic empowerment

title: Unusual cheque transactions lead to multiple arrests under ‘Op. Cy-Hunt’ in Ernakulam Rural
content: The rural police have nabbed 43 people, the highest number of arrests recorded as part of the drive, in raids conducted at 103 locations

title: Tirupati Collector clears air on reconstruction of Hathiramji Mutt
content: He urges Hathiramji Mutt Committee members not to believe the misconceptions being spread that the entire mutt will be demolished

title: IIT-Kanpur did Delhi cloud-seeding trial despite Met dept warning of ‘no clouds’
content: India’s State governments have in the past employed private companies to seed clouds, when their regions faced drought; the results have been hit-and-miss.

title: 'Fight over light switch': Bengaluru techie kills manager with dumbbell in office
content: A workplace dispute over switching off lights tragically escalated into murder in Bengaluru. A 41-year-old manager was bludgeoned to death with a dumbbell by a colleague after a heated argument. The accused, a 24-year-old technical executive, surrendered to the police. Investigations into the shocking incident are ongoing.

title: ‘Act of God’: Builder of Andhra temple where 9 died in stampede says nobody is responsible
content: A stampede at a privately run temple in Srikakulam district, Andhra Pradesh, killed nine devotees and injured over 25 when a railing collapsed on a narrow staircase. Panic ensued in a crowd of over 20,000 gathered for Karthika Ekadashi, with poor crowd control and lack of official clearance contributing to the tragedy. Authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Consumed by AI: Sam Altman admits OpenAI is consuming him; says it's ‘a little sad’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed envy for today's young entrepreneurs, particularly those skipping college to innovate. He noted that AI advancements allow small teams to build sophisticated products rapidly, a stark contrast to his early career. Altman also shared that OpenAI consumes his mental space, preventing him from pursuing new startup ideas.

title: Toxicity: 15% of deaths in Delhi linked to air pollution
content: Shocking data reveals air pollution claimed one in seven lives in Delhi during 2023. Ambient particulate matter was the primary culprit, responsible for approximately 15% of all fatalities, totaling around 17,200 deaths. This pollution also led to a staggering loss of nearly 4.9 lakh years of healthy life for the city's residents.

title: Ambulance jumps red signal, crashes into vehicles in Bengaluru; 2 dead
content: A speeding ambulance lost control near Richmond Circle in Bengaluru on Saturday night, colliding with motorcycles at a red light. The tragic accident resulted in the deaths of a couple and serious injuries to two others. The ambulance driver has been detained for questioning.

title: Alien object: Musk & Rogan discuss 3I/ATLAS heading toward Earth
content: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting unusual nickel composition and trajectory. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast with Elon Musk touched upon potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueling speculation about extraterrestrial origins.

title: Enrique Iglesias’ concert in Mumbai: 73 phones worth Rs 23.85 lakhs stolen
content: Enrique Iglesias lit up the stage in Mumbai, captivating over 25,000 fans with an electrifying 90-minute performance. However, the night took a dramatic turn as a brazen theft left attendees reeling—73 mobile phones, worth Rs 23.85 lakh, vanished amidst the excitement. Professionals, students, and fans alike fell victim to this unfortunate incident, casting a shadow on the celebration.

title: Amazon CEO: Layoffs are cultural; workers fear losing jobs to AI
content: Amazon's recent job cuts are sparking global unease. CEO Andy Jassy cited cultural fit, not finances, for the layoffs. This signals a shift where workers must adapt to AI-driven environments. Companies are hiring AI specialists while other roles diminish. Employees face uncertainty, with many seeking new skills to stay relevant in a rapidly changing job market.

title: US strikes Caribbean again: Three killed in blitz on alleged drug boat
content: US forces have conducted another deadly strike on a drug trafficking vessel in the Caribbean. Three men aboard the ship were killed in the operation. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth confirmed the strike, stating the vessel was involved in illicit narcotics smuggling. This is part of a broader campaign against drug cartels.

title: China chill: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says China made it clear; 'they don't want Nvidia there'
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the U.S. government to reconsider restrictions on AI chip exports to China, warning that isolating the U.S. from China's vast developer ecosystem could cede AI talent to rivals. Despite China's effective shutdown of Nvidia's operations, the company secured significant deals with the U.S. Department of Energy, underscoring a pivot to fortified U.S. ties.

title: IND vs AUS: Harshit, Samson out! Gambhir makes three Playing XI changes
content: Team India made three changes to their Playing XI for the third T20I against Australia, with head coach Gautam Gambhir continuing to experiment ahead of next year's T20 World Cup. India opted to bowl first after winning the toss, seeking a series lead. Australia also made one change, aiming to post a big total on a batting-friendly Hobart wicket.

title: Puke drama: Lucknow police bust all-women gang that used ‘fake vomit’ trick to steal gold
content: Lucknow Police have apprehended a six-member all-women gang specializing in gold ornament theft. The criminals employed a shocking tactic, feigning vomiting to create panic and distraction, allowing them to snatch jewelry from unsuspecting passengers. Recovered items include gold chains, a locket, and cash, with investigations ongoing for further connections.

title: 51-year-old GHMC worker raped on foot over bridge in Hyderabad
content: A 51-year-old GHMC sanitation worker was brutally raped on a foot over bridge in Erragadda by an inebriated 45-year-old watchman early Friday. The survivor, en route to her duties, was threatened and assaulted before the accused fled. Police swiftly arrested the perpetrator after reviewing CCTV footage and registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: 'King' title reveal: Shah Rukh Khan promises fans 'New SRK Experience' with film's teaser - Watch
content: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan has unveiled the first look of his upcoming film, 'King', on his 60th birthday. Director Siddharth Anand shared a teaser showcasing SRK in a powerful mafia role, promising a fresh experience for fans. The film, officially titled 'King', is slated for a 2026 release, with the teaser hinting at a globally renowned character.

title: Dropped but not done! Karun lets his bat do the talking; smashes double century
content: Karun Nair's stellar domestic form continues with a double century for Karnataka against Kerala. Despite recent national team setbacks, Nair remains focused on scoring runs, aiming to win games for his team. He expressed disappointment at being overlooked but is determined to keep performing, with playing for India as his ultimate goal.

title: Watch: Boy takes 'don't want to go to school' to new heights, gets carried on a cot
content: A young boy's determined refusal to attend school led to a comical scene as his family, opting for an unconventional approach, carried his entire bed to the school gates. The viral video shows the child clinging to his cot, much to the amusement of onlookers and social media users who reminisced about their own childhood school struggles.

title: ‘They’ve got a knife, run!’ Witnesses recount UK train stabbing horror; 9 critical
content: A mass stabbing on a London-bound train left ten people hospitalized, nine critically injured, as a man armed with a large knife moved through carriages. Passengers fled in terror, with some describing scenes of chaos and blood. Police tasered and restrained a suspect at the emergency stop in Huntingdon.

title: 'A good driver can't become cook': Gambhir draws flak
content: Former opener Sadagoppan Ramesh slammed India's batting order flux in the second T20I against Australia. He questioned promoting Harshit Rana over Shivam Dube and Sanju Samson batting at number three. Ramesh stressed the need for clarity on player roles, arguing that inconsistent changes are hindering team performance and causing confusion.

title: CBSE rewires schooling: AI from Class 3; classrooms brace for disruption
content: The Ministry of Education has announced that Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Computational Thinking (CT) will become mandatory subjects from Class 3 onwards starting in the 2026–27 session. The initiative, aligned with NEP 2020 and NCF SE 2023, aims to make AI a basic universal skill. With teacher training, ethical safeguards, and a focus on “AI for Public Good”, the curriculum seeks to prepare students for a rapidly evolving, AI-driven global economy.

title: Gujarat shocker: Woman’s ex-boyfriend stabs her husband; victim survives with 70 stitches
content: A woman in Ahmedabad filed a complaint against her ex-boyfriend for allegedly stabbing her husband near Jagatpur Bridge. The assailant reportedly entered the couple's car and attacked the husband with a knife. The husband sustained multiple stab wounds and received extensive stitches, while the woman suffered minor injuries.

title: 'Celebrating English festival Halloween': BJP reminds Lalu Yadav called Maha Kumbh 'faltu'
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav faces BJP's ire over Halloween celebrations, accused of hypocrisy after previously dismissing the Maha Kumbh as 'meaningless'. Videos of the RJD chief with grandchildren in costumes sparked criticism, with the BJP alleging an insult to faith ahead of Bihar polls. The controversy highlights political divides over religious and cultural observances.

title: At 114, 2025 stampede toll 2nd-highest in recent years; Andhra tragedy 6th incident this year
content: This year has witnessed a tragic surge in stampedes, claiming at least 114 lives, the second-highest toll in recent years. Major incidents include a crowd crush in Hathras, UP, and a stampede at the Venkateswara Swamy Temple in Andhra Pradesh, highlighting systemic failures in crowd management and emergency response.

title: IND vs SA: Rain threat looms! What happens if weather spoils women's world cup final
content: India and South Africa's ICC Women's World Cup final faces a weather threat in Navi Mumbai, with rain potentially disrupting the highly anticipated clash. A reserve day is in place, and the ICC has outlined rules for reduced overs or shared trophies if play is impossible.

title: Watch: Hamas loots Gaza aid truck; US military drone catches it on camera
content: US Central Command released drone footage showing suspected Hamas operatives looting an aid truck in southern Gaza. The operatives attacked the driver and stole the truck and its contents, undermining international efforts to deliver vital assistance. Senator Marco Rubio condemned the act, calling Hamas an impediment to aid for Gazan civilians.

title: US ends EAD extensions, hikes H-1B fees, toughens citizenship test for Indians
content: The US has implemented three major immigration changes affecting Indian professionals and Green Card holders. Automatic EAD extensions have ended, H-1B visa fees have risen to $100,000 for new petitions, and the civics test for naturalisation has become more challenging. These changes introduce delays, higher costs, and stricter eligibility requirements, directly impacting employment, career planning, and citizenship pathways for Indians. Companies sponsoring Indian talent are also adjusting hiring practices in response to the new rules.

title: History of Women’s World Cup finals: Which teams triumph and which missed out?
content: India and South Africa are set to clash in the 2025 ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup final, with India aiming for their first title after two previous runner-up finishes. South Africa makes its maiden appearance in the final, having secured a dominant victory in their semi-final match.

title: Former Trump golf club worker accidentally deported due to ICE error
content: Alejandro Juarez, a longtime New York resident and former Trump golf club worker, was wrongfully deported to Mexico after ICE agents placed him on the wrong flight. The error, uncovered through internal emails, triggered national outrage and a federal review. His lawyer, Anibal Romero, says DHS has admitted the mistake and is working to return him.

title: All new locations in Fortnite Simpsons update
content: Fortnite's Springfield map is now live, featuring iconic locations like the Nuclear Power Plant and Evergreen Terrace in its signature cel-shaded style. This smaller map accommodates 80 players, promising quicker, more thrilling battles. Explore nine distinct areas, from Burns Manor to the Donut District, for a truly immersive Simpsons experience.

title: SNL: 'Mamdani' steals the show, says 'hit me up at the ballot box, girl'
content: Saturday Night Live's New York City mayoral debate sketch featured Miles Teller as Andrew Cuomo, Ramy Youssef as Zohran Mamdani, and Kenan Thompson as Errol Louis. The chaotic debate took a turn with a surprise cameo from James Austin Johnson's Donald Trump, who declared himself the true star and potential next mayor.

title: H-1B visa LCA submissions: FLAG system back online; employers can resume applications
content: US employers can now submit applications for crucial foreign worker visa programs like H-1B and PERM. The Department of Labor's Foreign Labor Application Gateway (FLAG) system is back online after a funding lapse caused a temporary shutdown. While processing has resumed, expect delays as the agency clears a backlog of applications.

title: Mice on space crew: China launches youngest astronaut on Shenzhou-21 with 4 small mammals
content: China launched its Shenzhou-21 mission, sending three astronauts, including its youngest ever, to the Tiangong space station. This marks the seventh crewed flight to the station, with the astronauts set to replace the current crew and conduct experiments with the first small mammals in orbit. The mission underscores China's expanding space program and its growing competition with the United States.

title: Tyler Glasnow shines in Game 6 as Dodgers ace wins hearts on and off the field
content: Dodgers pitcher Tyler Glasnow displayed remarkable composure in a critical Game 6. He rescued his team with a three-pitch escape, showcasing his ability to perform under immense pressure. Off the field, his charming courtship with physician assistant Meghan Murphy adds another layer to his story. Glasnow's balance of on-field success and grounded personal life makes him a standout figure.

title: Mokama murder case: JD(U) candidate Anant Singh arrested in connection with Jan Suraaj worker’s killing
content: Janata Dal (United) candidate Anant Singh was arrested by Patna Police in connection with the murder of Jan Suraaj Party worker Dularchand Yadav. The 75-year-old was shot and run over during a clash between rival groups while campaigning. The arrest follows evidence and eyewitness accounts, with accomplices also taken into custody.

title: Knife attack in Karnataka: 5 stabbed during Kannada Rajyotsava celebrations; 2 critical
content: Five individuals were injured, with two sustaining serious wounds, during Kannada Rajyotsava celebrations in Belagavi. Miscreants reportedly stabbed the victims indiscriminately near Laxmi Complex before fleeing. Authorities are investigating the incident, suspecting outsiders may be involved.

title: Bopanna's retirement: Sachin Tendulkar - 'Always believed sport reveals character'
content: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar lauded Rohan Bopanna's inspiring career as the Indian tennis star officially retired after over two decades. Bopanna, who achieved remarkable milestones including becoming the oldest Grand Slam winner and World No. 1, expressed his pride in representing India. He remains committed to developing the sport through his academy and UTR Tennis Pro.

title: Uttar Pradesh expands medical education: 950 MBBS seats; 271 PG seats added
content: Uttar Pradesh MBBS seats: Uttar Pradesh has approved the addition of 950 MBBS and 271 PG seats across government and private medical colleges for the 2025-26 academic session. Government colleges will gain 200 MBBS and 233 PG seats, while private institutions will add 750 MBBS and 38 PG seats. This expansion increases total MBBS seats to 12,800 and total PG seats to 4,297, aiming to strengthen healthcare infrastructure, enhance medical education capacity, and address doctor shortages across urban and rural areas in the state.

title: Gujarat: 15-yr-old kills brother, rapes and murders pregnant sister-in-law; shows no remorse
content: A 15-year-old boy in Gujarat allegedly murdered his elder brother and six-months-pregnant sister-in-law, then confessed to raping her before killing her. The motive appears to be resentment over his brother's mistreatment. The mother is arrested for aiding in the burial and evidence destruction. The crime was uncovered after the sister-in-law's family became suspicious.

title: ‘Blood stains were washed’: Girl dies after falling from 4th floor of school
content: A nine-year-old girl died after falling from the fourth floor of Neerja Modi School in Jaipur under suspicious circumstances. Police have filed a negligence case against the school management and staff, with CCTV footage recovered and FSL teams collecting samples. The school principal stated the girl asked for washroom access before the incident.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment with daughter Gianna
content: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.

title: Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi mark 2nd anniversary, share pic with baby Vaayuv
content: Varun Tej Konidela and Lavanya Tripathi celebrated their second wedding anniversary with heartfelt social media tributes and adorable family photos featuring their son, Vaayuv. Their journey, which began on the sets of 'Mister' in 2016, has blossomed into a beautiful family life. This milestone marks their first anniversary as parents, adding a new layer of joy to their union.

title: Multiple people stabbed on London-bound train: Nine critically injured; what we know so far
content: Two individuals were apprehended on Saturday following a stabbing incident aboard a train in Cambridgeshire, resulting in multiple passenger injuries and a significant emergency response. Rail services were suspended as armed police secured the scene at Huntingdon station, with several victims transported to hospital. An investigation is ongoing.

title: Woman’s decomposed body found in rented Bengaluru house
content: A 25-year-old woman, Supriya, was discovered deceased in her locked Bengaluru residence on Saturday. Her body was found hanging in a room on the third floor. Police have seized her mobile phone for forensic analysis. A case of unnatural death has been registered following a complaint from her family.

title: First Indian woman! 32-yo Pundole on the brink of history with Ferrari
content: Pune's Diana Pundole is set to make history as the first Indian woman to race a Ferrari internationally. Competing in the Ferrari Club Challenge Middle East from November 2025 to April 2026, she will drive the powerful 296 Challenge car across renowned F1 tracks in the region. This significant achievement aims to inspire more Indian women to embrace motorsport.

title: Dodgers steal Game 7 late to repeat as champs
content: The Dodgers enjoyed memorable performances from Miguel Rojas, Will Smith and Yoshinobu Yamamoto as they held off the Blue Jays to repeat as World Series champs.

title: Yamamoto seals MVP with epic Game 7 in relief
content: A day after throwing 96 pitches in a Game 6 win, Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched 2⅔ scoreless innings in relief to help lead the Dodgers to victory in Saturday's Game 7.

title: Jays feel sting of defeat as title slips from grasp
content: Tears abounded in the Blue Jays' locker room following a heartbreaking Game 7 World Series loss characterized by missed opportunities, bad breaks and what-ifs.

title: Sources: Teams eye Seahawks vets in trade talks
content: Teams have inquired to the Seahawks about the availability of standout linebacker Boye Mafe and former Pro Bowl cornerback Riq Woolen, sources told ESPN.

title: Tech wrecked: NC St. hands No. 8 Jackets 1st loss
content: Playing without injured running back Hollywood Smothers, the ACC's rushing leader, NC State stunned No. 8 Georgia Tech 48-36 on Saturday night, ending the Yellow Jackets' unbeaten run, and giving the Wolfpack their first win over a top-10 foe since 2021.

title: Ravens deal ex-Pro Bowl CB Alexander to Eagles
content: The Eagles added cornerback depth on Saturday, acquiring former Pro Bowl CB Jaire Alexander and a 2027 seventh-round pick from the Ravens in exchange for a 2026 sixth-round pick.

title: Deion blocks player interviews after blowout loss
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders didn't allow his players to talk after Saturday's blowout loss to Arizona, saying he was solely to blame.

title: Grizzlies suspend Morant for detrimental conduct
content: The Grizzlies suspended star point guard Ja Morant for one game because of conduct detrimental to the team.

title: 😎 Social media reacts to Dodgers' WS title
content: The Dodgers prevailed in one of the greatest World Series Game 7s ever, and the sports world was stoked.

title: Way-too-early 2026 MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Blue Jays No. 1?
content: Los Angeles just won the 2025 World Series -- and we're already looking ahead to next year. Where does your favorite team fall?

title: Overheard in college football Week 10: Steve Sarkisian, Ryan Day headline top quotes
content: Steve Sarkisian took a positive outlook on his team's shaky fourth quarter during its win over Vanderbilt, among other Week 10 quips.

title: As it happened: Liverpool return to form vs. Villa, Man Utd draw
content: Re-live all of Saturday's soccer action across Europe, with Liverpool beating Villa, United sharing the points with Forest, and Bayern looking unstoppable in Germany.

title: Raucous Anfield crowd backs Slot as Liverpool returns to form
content: Liverpool stopped the rot with a steady 2-0 win over Aston Villa on Saturday, roared on by an Anfield crowd that stood firm with Arne Slot in the home dugout.

title: Saturday Night's Main Event takeaways: Has Jey Uso's time to claim the World Heavyweight title passed?
content: CM Punk and Jade Cargill are now WWE champions. Andreas Hale and Arda Ocal recap the four title matches on WWE Saturday Night's Main Event.

title: Ready for NFL Week 9? We have sleepers, potential surprises, trends to watch and more
content: Will Christian McCaffrey and Sam Darnold go off? Can the Steelers upset the Colts? And could the Bills slow the Chiefs? Here's what to know for Week 9.

title: Five things to watch in J.J. McCarthy's return as Vikings' starting QB
content: It's time to see whether McCarthy can stay healthy and live up to the hype as the 2024 No. 10 draft pick.

title: Our NFL trade grades: Did the Eagles fix their CB situation with Alexander, Carter?
content: We're grading deals leading into the Tuesday NFL trade deadline, including the Eagles adding Michael Carter II and Jaire Alexander.

title: Patrick Mahomes vs. Josh Allen, Round 10: AFC foes who are more similar than you would think
content: Another round of Patrick Mahomes vs. Josh Allen, including the matchup and where the two teams are in Week 9.

title: Why is Mike McDaniel still in Miami? Answering key questions about Dolphins' shakeup
content: Answering the key questions following the Dolphins' decision to part ways with Chris Grier and keep Mike McDaniel.

title: Buzz: Updates on Jayden Daniels, other returning QBs for Week 9
content: Stephania Bell provides updates on what to expect from Jayden Daniels and three other QBs expected to return this week.

title: 🎠 Resetting the college football coaching carousel
content: Coaching changes are happening fast. With a month left in the season, here are six things to monitor.

title: 🏈 Governor: LSU AD won't select football coach
content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry told reporters Wednesday that LSU athletic director Scott Woodward won't be involved in selecting the Tigers' new football coach in the wake of Brian Kelly's firing.

title: 🏀 Jordan: Load management never should happen
content: Michael Jordan didn't hold back on load management in the NBA, saying on NBC: "It shouldn't be needed, first and foremost."

title: ⚾ Chapman: I'd rather retire than rejoin Yankees
content: Aroldis Chapman ripped the Yankees in a podcast, saying he would "retire on the spot" before playing for them ever again.

title: 👑 The legend of Georgia Tech QB Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: ↔️ Pats trade White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: NYC Marathon pacers guide thousands of runners to glory
content: NYC Marathon pacers are the human metronomes keeping runners on track in the race's most challenging moments.

title: 17 men's college basketball teams that could win 30 games in 2025-26
content: History says a 30-win season could lead to a national title (see: Florida). Which teams could achieve the feat this season?

title: Storylines to watch in all 31 men's basketball conferences
content: Will UConn or St. John's win the Big East? Here are questions that could shape every league in 2025-26.

title: Briscoe, Byron, Hamlin, Larson: Who will be crowned NASCAR champion on Sunday?
content: Just four drivers are left standing in NASCAR's 2025 playoffs, and come Sunday afternoon in Phoenix, one of them will be crowned Cup Series champion.

title: "Should Infiltrators Have Voting Rights?" Amit Shah At NDTV Bihar Conclave
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah today said that Bihar is one of the most politically aware states in the country, ahead of assembly elections in the state this month.

title: 42 Fugitives Extradited, More To Follow After Judicial Process: Amit Shah To NDTV
content: The government has extradited 42 fugitives over the past two years, said Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday, assuring that many more will be brought back after the due judicial process in the countries they are staying in.

title: "Would Be Good To Catch Up": Andrew Planned To Meet Epstein After His Release From Jail
content: The emails were made public on Friday, two days after Buckingham Palace stripped Andrew Mountbatten Windsor of his titles.

title: "Cares More About His Toilet": Democrats Slam Trump's Bathroom Reveal Amid Shutdown
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday revealed a lavish renovation of the Lincoln Bedroom's bathroom, the latest in his White House makeover, drawing fire for flaunting luxury upgrades as the government shutdown enters its second month.

title: "Awful Situation": Priyanka Gandhi Flags Toxic Delhi Air To PM, Rekha Gupta
content: As Delhi woke up to another smoggy morning and Air Quality Index (AQI) in several areas climbed to the 'severe' category, senior Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra called upon the Centre and the BJP-led Delhi government to act immediately.

title: "We Will Destroy Drug Cartels By 2029": Amit Shah To NDTV
content: Speaking to NDTV's Rahul Kanwal at the Bihar Power Play conclave, Amit Shah said their fight against drugs has been going on with "very good" planning.

title: Foreign Diplomats Arrive In Bihar To Study Poll Process Under 'Know BJP' Initiative
content: A delegation of diplomats from seven countries is visiting Bihar on Sunday as part of the BJP's outreach programme, "Know BJP," an initiative launched by the party's national President JP Nadda.

title: Lalu Yadav's Halloween Fest With Grandchildren Draws BJP's 'Kumbh' Reminder
content: The BJP has hit out at Lalu Yadav over Halloween celebrations at his home, pointing out that the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) patriarch had criticised the Kumbh festival.

title: Bihar 'Bahubali' Anant Singh: The Man In White With Dark Crimes To His Name
content: Anant Kumar Singh AKA Chhote Sarkar, the JDU strongman arrested in a murder case, is a colourful character who mostly wears white. Mostly seen in sunglasses and white clothes, Singh enjoys a near-cult status on social media

title: On Camera, US Immigration Agent Punches Restrained Man After Car Crash
content: Police in a Chicago suburb are collecting videos and other evidence to send to the Illinois attorney general's office after a car crash involving a US Border Patrol vehicle led to a violent arrest caught on video.

title: Speeding Ambulance Jumps Red Signal, Kills Couple On Scooter In Bengaluru
content: An ambulance, a vehicle meant to save lives, turned fatal in Bengaluru when it lost control and rammed into multiple motorcycles stopped at a red signal, killing a couple on the spot.

title: Obama Offers To Be Zohran Mamdani's "Sounding Board" Ahead Of Mayor Polls
content: Former Democratic President Barack Obama called New York mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani Saturday and offered to be a "sounding board" if the 34-year-old frontrunner wins the election.

title: "There Was Blood Everywhere": Witnesses Recount UK Train Stabbing
content: Ten people were injured following a mass stabbing on a London-bound train on Saturday evening, with the police arresting two suspects. Of the injured, nine have "life-threatening injuries."

title: "Intentional" Explosion At Harvard Medical School, 2 Suspects Caught On CCTV
content: There was an explosion early Saturday at Harvard Medical School that appears to have been intentional, but no one was injured, authorities said.

title: Epstein's Ties To Wall Street Figures Exposed In Newly Unsealed Records
content: The now unsealed records, part of a lawsuit between the US Virgin Islands and JPMorgan Chase, include hundreds of pages of emails, financial reports, and internal bank documents.

title: "I Was Surprised": Indian Man On Changing Clocks For Daylight Saving In US
content: Yes, you'll get a shot at an extra hour's sleep. But even with that, it might be one of the most dreaded weekends on the American calendar: the end of daylight saving time.

title: Class 4 Girl Jumps To Death In Jaipur School, No Bloodstains At Site
content: A 9-year-old girl died on Saturday afternoon after allegedly jumping off the fourth floor of a private school in Jaipur.

title: On Camera, Bengaluru Cab Driver Rams Bike After Argument
content: Another road rage incident has been reported from Bengaluru, where a cab driver deliberately rammed his car into a bike following an argument.

title: Delhi's Air Quality Nears 'Severe' Mark, Thick Smog Lowers Visibility
content: The national capital witnessed a sharp deterioration in air quality on Sunday morning, with pollution levels slipping deep into the 'very poor' category and touching 'severe' levels in several parts of Delhi-NCR.

title: CFP top 12: One last projection before the first committee ranking

title: Week 10 truths: Miami is a mess, Ohio State looks like a sure thing
content: at points in history, the wisest among us believed, with some degree of certainty, that the earth was flat, that sea dragons consumed ships filled with gold, that Texas was back . in time, most of us who aren't Kyrie Irving have come to understand the folly of such ideas . they simply lacked information, but as we learn more, we refine our notions of how the world works .

title: Recruiting intel: Vandy coming for UGA's QB; top prospect in the middle of LSU's coaching change

title: Every MLB team's odds to win the 2026 World Series: Dodgers open as favorites
content: The confetti has fallen on the 2025 MLB season, as the  Los Angeles Dodgers  completed a Game 7 comeback for the ages and claimed their second straight World Series championship, this time over the American League champion  Toronto Blue Jays . The star-studded Dodgers -- featuring  Shohei Ohtani  and  Mookie Betts  -- will return as the favorites to win the 2026 World Series, followed by the  New York Yankees ,  Houston Astros  and  Philadelphia Phillies . The Blue Jays open at 20-1, tied with the  Chicago Cubs  for 11th. The  Seattle Mariners , the AL runners-up, open at 14-1, while the  Milwaukee Brewers , who had the league's best record in 2025, open at 18-1. At the other end of the spectrum, the  Chicago White Sox  and  Colorado Rockies  open at 500-1. Odds as of publish time. For more, visit  ESPN BET Sportsbook.   By ESPN BET

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: Tottenham were devoid of ideas vs. Chelsea, and fans are turning on Thomas Frank
content: Janusz Michallik sings the praises of Moisés Caicedo after his starring performance in Chelsea's win over Tottenham . the 1-0 defeat to Chelsea was greeted with a chorus of boos at both the halftime and fulltime whistles . his own players, Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence, appeared to ignore his request to stay on the pitch .
